  <resource src="LaTeXML.css" type="text/css"/>

  <resource src="ltx-amsart.css" type="text/css"/>
  <title>Biharmonic maps and morphisms from conformal mappings</title>
  <toctitle>Biharmonic maps and morphisms</toctitle>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>E. Loubeau</personname>
    <contact role="address">Département de Mathématiques<break/>Université de Bretagne Occidentale<break/>6, avenue Victor Le Gorgeu<break/>BP 809<break/>29285 Brest Cedex<break/>France.</contact>
    <contact role="email">Eric.Loubeau@univ-brest.fr</contact>
  </creator>
  <creator before=" and " role="author">
    <personname>Y.-L. Ou*</personname>
    <contact role="address">Department of Mathematics <break/>Texas A&amp;M University-Commerce <break/>Commerce, TX 75429<break/>USA.</contact>
    <contact role="email">yelin_ou@tamu-commerce.edu</contact>
  </creator>
  <date name="Date:" role="creation">November 30, 2018</date>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>Inspired by the all-important conformal invariance of harmonic maps on
two-dimensional domains, this article studies the relationship between biharmonicity
<!--  %**** String Line 25 **** -->and conformality. We first give a characterization of biharmonic morphisms,
analogues of harmonic morphisms investigated by Fuglede and Ishihara, which, in
particular, explicits the conditions required for a conformal map in dimension four
to preserve biharmonicity and helps producing the first example of a biharmonic
morphism which is not a special type of harmonic morphism. Then, we compute
the bitension field of horizontally weakly conformal maps, which
include conformal mappings. This leads to several examples of proper (i.e. non-harmonic) biharmonic
conformal maps, in which dimension four plays a pivotal role.
We also construct a family of Riemannian submersions which are proper biharmonic maps.</p>
  </abstract>
  <keywords name="Key words and phrases">biharmonic maps, conformal maps</keywords>
  <classification name="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification" scheme="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification">58E20</classification>
  <acknowledgements>Part of this work was done at the University of California at Riverside. <break/>* Supported by the Texas A &amp; M University-Commerce Faculty Mini-Grant Program 2007.</acknowledgements>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S1">
    <tags>
      <tag>1</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§1</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">1</tag>Introduction</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">1</tag>Introduction</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>A central feature of harmonic maps is their conformal invariance in dimension two.
Not only this allows defining harmonic maps on Riemann
surfaces but it also is the starting point to many properties of minimal branched immersions.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p2">
      <p>In the higher-order theory of biharmonic maps, one could expect similar properties in
dimension four. While this dimension certainly enjoys a special role for
biharmonicity, as illustrated by the conformal deformation of harmonic maps
of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="B-K" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the study of the biharmonic stress-energy tensor or the
characterization of biharmonic morphisms of Section <ref labelref="LABEL:section1"/>, no conformal
invariance of any sort has ever been observed.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p3">
      <p>Nevertheless, the interaction between conformality and biharmonicity remains a rich
subject and provides an interesting source of new examples.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p4">
      <p>In the theory of harmonic maps, a particularly fruitful approach has been to consider
maps which preserve local harmonic functions, called harmonic morphisms, because
their characterization as horizontally weakly conformal (a generalization of
Riemannian submersions) harmonic maps confers them a more geometrical flavour, which
counterweighs the analytical nature of harmonic maps (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fug,Ish" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).
<!--  %**** String Line 75 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p5">
      <p>Their numerous geometrical properties have earned harmonic morphisms a choice place
among harmonic maps. The counterparts of these are biharmonic morphisms (see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="OuB" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>),
maps which pull back local biharmonic functions onto biharmonic
functions (and also, as it turns out, maps) and we characterize them as horizontally
weakly conformal biharmonic maps which are <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S1.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-harmonic and satisfy an additional
equation, whose significance remains largely enigmatic.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p6">
      <p>While the number of conditions is directly due to the order of the problem, the
appearance of <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S1.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-harmonicity is yet another clue to the specificity of dimension
four.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p7">
      <p>This characterization also solves one aspect of the original question on the
conformal invariance of biharmonic maps on four dimensional domains, since two extra
conditions are required.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S2">
    <tags>
      <tag>2</tag>

    <title><tag close=". ">2</tag><Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.m1">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>-Harmonicity and biharmonicity</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">2</tag><Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.m2">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>-Harmonicity and biharmonicity</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S2.p1">
      <p>At the origin of this work, lie the search and study of maps selected as extremals of
a measured quantity and the most natural class of functionals on the space of maps
between Riemannian manifolds is the <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-energies.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_de" inlist="thm theorem:de" xml:id="Thmde1">

      <para xml:id="Thmde1.p1">

            <XMath>

            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic">-energy</text> is</p>

          </Math>.<break/>Standard arguments yield the associated Euler-Lagrange equation, the vanishing of the

          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where</p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\tau(\phi)=\operatorname{trace}{\nabla d\phi}" text="tau * phi = trace * nabla@(d * phi)" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">trace</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>is the tension field.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rk" inlist="thm theorem:rk" xml:id="Thmrk1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmrk1.p1">
        <p>i) A fundamental feature of <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonicity for <Math mode="inline" tex="p\neq 2" text="p not-equals 2" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, is the collapse of
ellipticity at critical points and its negative consequences for regularity
properties (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="H-L" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>). For <Math mode="inline" tex="p=2" text="p = 2" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, smoothness of continuous
harmonic maps is ensured by boot-strap methods and strong uniqueness, for example, follows.<break/>ii) The main existence result for <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic maps (<Math mode="inline" tex="p&gt;2" text="p &gt; 2" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) is due to Duzaar and
Fuchs in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D-F" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and generalizes the Eells-Sampson theorem.<break/>iii) Working directly with the functional, one sees that, if <Math mode="inline" tex="p=\dim{M}" text="p = dimension@(M)" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="dimension" role="LIMITOP">dim</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="E_{p}" text="E _ p" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
conformally invariant, a situation that seems more natural since, when the target
has trivial <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-th homotopy group,
<Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="Thmrk1.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic maps exist in each homotopy class (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Jost" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S2.p2">
      <p>While harmonic maps have been extensively studied and shown to exist in numerous
circumstances (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="E-L" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>), in some situations they cannot exist or are very
limited. It is therefore interesting to turn to an alternative measuring the default
<!--  %**** String Line 125 **** -->of harmonicity.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_de" inlist="thm theorem:de" xml:id="Thmde2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmde2.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi:(M,g)\to(N,h)" text="phi colon open-interval@(M, g) to open-interval@(N, h)" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m1.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m1.2">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m1.3">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m1.4">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a smooth map between compact Riemannian manifolds.
Define its <text font="italic">bienergy</text> as</p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex4">
          <Math mode="display" tex="E^{2}(\phi)=\tfrac{1}{2}\int_{M}|\tau(\phi)|^{2}\,v_{g}." text="E ^ 2 * phi = (1 / 2) * (integral _ M)@((absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 2 * v _ g)" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.3">

                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.1"/>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.1">ϕ</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>

                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.3.1"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.3.1">
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.2"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.2">ϕ</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Critical points of the functional <Math mode="inline" tex="E^{2}" text="E ^ 2" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are called <text font="italic">biharmonic maps</text> and its
associated Euler-Lagrange equation is the vanishing of the <text font="italic">bitension field</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex5">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\tau^{2}(\phi)=-\Delta^{\phi}\tau(\phi)-\operatorname{trace}_{g}{R^{N}}(d\phi,%&#10;\tau(\phi))d\phi," text="tau ^ 2 * phi = - Delta ^ phi * tau * phi - (trace _ g)@(R ^ N) * open-interval@(d * phi, tau * phi) * d * phi" xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.1"/>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.2">ϕ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">trace</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.4.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.4.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.3"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.3">ϕ</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta^{\phi}=-\operatorname{trace}_{g}(\nabla^{\phi}\nabla^{\phi}-\nabla^{%&#10;\phi}_{\nabla})" text="Delta ^ phi = - (trace _ g)@((nabla ^ phi)@(nabla ^ phi) - (nabla ^ phi) _ nabla)" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m3.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">trace</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m3.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the
Laplacian on sections of <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi^{-1}TN" text="phi ^ (- 1) * T * N" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="R^{N}" text="R ^ N" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the Riemann curvature operator on
<Math mode="inline" tex="(N,h)" text="open-interval@(N, h)" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m6.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmde2.p1.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m6.1">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde2.p1.m6.2">h</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rk" inlist="thm theorem:rk" xml:id="Thmrk2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmrk2.p1">
        <p>i) Clearly harmonic maps are automatically biharmonic, actually absolute minimums of
<Math mode="inline" tex="E^{2}" text="E ^ 2" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
For compact domains and negatively curved targets, the converse holds (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Jiang" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).<break/>ii) An alternative to <Math mode="inline" tex="E^{2}" text="E ^ 2" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is to view <Math mode="inline" tex="(N,h)" text="open-interval@(N, h)" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmrk2.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmrk2.p1.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m3.1">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m3.2">h</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> isometrically immersed in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}}^{N}" text="R ^ N" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and,
considering <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as a vector, take the <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-norm of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta\phi" text="Delta * phi" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and call the
critical points <text font="italic">(extrinsic) biharmonic maps</text>. Except for flat targets, the two
definitions are distinct.
The regularity of both types of biharmonic maps has been extensively studied in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="C-W-Y,W1,W2,W3" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.<break/>iii) If <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="Thmrk2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is non compact, we extend all these definitions by integrating over
compact subsets.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
<!--  %**** String Line 150 **** -->    <para xml:id="S2.p3">
      <p>A natural generalization of isometric immersions are weakly conformal maps, i.e.
whose differential either vanishes or is injective and conformal. Of particular
interest is their harmonicity since it characterizes minimality of the image and
defines minimal branched immersions. They also explain the conformal invariance of
harmonic maps on surfaces, directly at the level of the tension field.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p4">
      <p>Dual to this notion is horizontal weak conformality where, pointwise, the
differential is required to vanish or be surjective and conformal. This reverses the
constraint on the dimensions and enables a preservation of harmonicity in higher
dimensions.</p>
    </para>

          </Math> are called <text font="italic">regular</text>.</p>

<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** -->    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rk" inlist="thm theorem:rk" xml:id="Thmrk3">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 3</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmrk3.p1">
        <p>i) If <Math mode="inline" tex="m&lt;n" text="m less n" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is horizontally weakly conformal if and only if it is constant. <break/>ii) By extending the function <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda" text="lambda" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by zero over critical points, we obtain a
smooth
function <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda^{2}" text="lambda ^ 2" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined on the whole of <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Besides <Math mode="inline" tex="|d\phi|^{2}=n\lambda^{2}" text="(absolute-value@(d * phi)) ^ 2 = n * lambda ^ 2" xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmrk3.p1.m6.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Thmrk3.p1.m6.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.<break/>iii) Harmonic morphisms, i.e. maps which preserve local harmonic functions by
composition on the right-hand side, were characterized by Fuglede and Ishihara, as
horizontally weakly conformal harmonic maps (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fug,Ish" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S2.p5">
      <p>Conventions: We will systematically use the Einstein convention on summing repeated indices.<break/>Our convention for the Riemann curvature tensor will be</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex7">
        <Math mode="display" tex="R(X,Y)=[\nabla_{X},\nabla_{Y}]-\nabla_{[X,Y]}," text="R * open-interval@(X, Y) = closed-interval@(nabla _ X, nabla _ Y) - nabla _ (closed-interval@(X, Y))" xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.5"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.5">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.3">X</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.4">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.5.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.5.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Ex7.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.1">X</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex7.m1.2">Y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>and the Laplacian on functions has been chosen with negative eigenvalues, i.e. <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta f=\operatorname{trace}\nabla df" text="Delta * f = trace * nabla@(d * f)" xml:id="S2.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">trace</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> but on vector fields <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta X=-\operatorname{trace}\nabla^{2}X" text="Delta * X = - trace * (nabla ^ 2)@(X)" xml:id="S2.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">trace</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:section1" xml:id="S3">
    <tags>
      <tag>3</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§3</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">3</tag>The characterization of biharmonic morphisms</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">3</tag>The characterization of biharmonic morphisms</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S3.p1">
      <p>In this section, we give an improvement of the characterization of biharmonic
morphisms and show that the inversion in the unit sphere <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}}^{n}\setminus\{0\}\to{{\mathbb{R}}}^{n}" text="R ^ n set-minus set@(0) to R ^ n" xml:id="S3.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m1.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p1.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a biharmonic morphism if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="n=4" text="n = 4" xml:id="S3.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, thus providing an example
which, unlike any of the previously known ones, is not a harmonic morphism.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p2">
      <p>In light of the theory of harmonic morphisms, cf. the monograph <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="B-W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, it only
seemed natural to define and study their biharmonic counterparts.
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_de" inlist="thm theorem:de" xml:id="Thmde4">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 4</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmde4.p1">
        <p>A continuous map <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi:(M,g)\to(N,h)" text="phi colon open-interval@(M, g) to open-interval@(N, h)" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m1.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m1.2">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m1.3">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m1.4">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a <text font="italic">biharmonic morphism</text> if, for any
biharmonic function <Math mode="inline" tex="f:U\subset N\to{{\mathbb{R}}}" text="f colon U subset-of N to R" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi^{-1}(U)\neq\emptyset" text="phi ^ (- 1) * U not-equals empty-set" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m3.1">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="empty-set" name="emptyset" role="ID">∅</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
the pull-back function <Math mode="inline" tex="f\circ\phi:\phi^{-1}(U)\subset M\to{{\mathbb{R}}}" text="f compose phi colon phi ^ (- 1) * U subset-of M to R" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmde4.p1.m4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmde4.p1.m4.1">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is also
biharmonic.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rk" inlist="thm theorem:rk" xml:id="Thmrk4">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 4</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmrk4.p1">
        <p>i) Clearly constant maps and isometries are biharmonic morphisms and the composition
of
two biharmonic morphisms is again a biharmonic morphism.<break/>ii) Since harmonic functions are automatically biharmonic, a biharmonic morphism will
pull-back harmonic functions onto biharmonic ones, but not necessarily harmonic.
Likewise, there is no reason to believe that a harmonic morphism should be a
biharmonic morphism. This distinction is clarified by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm1"/> (see
also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="L-O" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).
Nevertheless, all the previously known examples of biharmonic morphisms came from special types of harmonic morphisms (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="L-O,OuB,Ou" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).<break/>iii) The existence of local harmonic coordinates on Riemannian manifolds
(<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D-K" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>), implies that in such a coordinate system, the components of a
biharmonic morphism are continuous biharmonic functions, hence smooth by standard
properties of elliptic partial differential equations. Therefore a biharmonic
morphism is always smooth.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
<!--  %**** String Line 225 **** -->    <para xml:id="S3.p3">
      <p>The geometric method used by Ishihara in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ish" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> to characterize harmonic
morphisms as horizontally weakly conformal harmonic maps, and co-opted for the
semi-Riemannian case in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fug96" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> by Fuglede (who had his own approach for
Riemannian metrics) is extended here to biharmonicity. As one should expect, four
conditions are needed to describe biharmonic morphisms, with the last one still very
much unfathomable.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm1" xml:id="Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi:(M^{m},g)\to(N^{n},h)" text="phi colon open-interval@(M ^ m, g) to open-interval@(N ^ n, h)" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m1.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m1.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m1.4"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m1.4">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m1.2">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a smooth map between Riemannian manifolds.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a biharmonic morphism if and only if it is a horizontally weakly conformal biharmonic <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-harmonic
map, of dilation <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda" text="lambda" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, such that</text></p>

                                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                                <XMDual>
                                                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.2"/>
                                                  <XMWrap>
                                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1.2">ϕ</XMTok>
                                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                                  </XMWrap>
                                                </XMDual>
                                              </XMApp>
                                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                            </XMWrap>
                                          </XMDual>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.3"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1.3">S</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p><text font="italic">where <Math mode="inline" tex="S\in\odot^{2}\phi^{-1}TN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="direct-product" name="odot" role="MULOP">⊙</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the symmetrization of the <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-trace of <Math mode="inline" tex="d\phi\otimes\nabla^{\phi}\tau(\phi)" text="((d * phi) tensor-product (nabla ^ phi)@(tau)) * phi" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m7.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi)\rangle(X)=\langle d\phi(X),\tau(\phi)\rangle" text="list@(d * phi, tau * phi) * X = list@(d * phi * X, tau * phi)" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.5"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.6"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.5">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.6">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.2">X</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.7"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.8"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.7">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.3">X</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.8">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="Thmthm1.p1.m8.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmthm1.p1.m8.4">ϕ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p4">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi:(M^{m},g)\to(N^{n},h)" text="phi colon open-interval@(M ^ m, g) to open-interval@(N ^ n, h)" xml:id="S3.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p4.m1.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m1.4"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p4.m1.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m1.2">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a smooth map between Riemannian manifolds,
then the statement of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm1"/> is that <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S3.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a biharmonic morphism
if and only if</p>

<break/>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="f:U\subset N\to{{\mathbb{R}}}" text="f colon U subset-of N to R" xml:id="S3.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>

                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>

                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a local function on <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S3.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx3">
          <equation labels="LABEL:eqe" xml:id="S3.E6">
            <tags>
              <tag>(6)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
            </tags>
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\Delta^{2}(f{\circ}\phi)=\frac{\partial^{4}f}{\partial y^{\alpha}%&#10;\partial y^{\beta}\partial y^{\gamma}\partial y^{\delta}}\left[g^{ij}g^{kl}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{%&#10;\partial x^{j}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\gamma}}{\partial x^{k}}\frac{\partial\phi^%&#10;{\delta}}{\partial x^{l}}\right]+" text="Delta ^ 2 * (f compose phi) = limit-from@(((partial-differential ^ 4)@(f) / (partial-differential@(y ^ alpha) * partial-differential@(y ^ beta) * partial-differential@(y ^ gamma) * partial-differential@(y ^ delta))) * delimited-[]@(g ^ (i * j) * g ^ (k * l) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ beta) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ gamma) / partial-differential@(x ^ k)) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ delta) / partial-differential@(x ^ l))), +)" xml:id="S3.E6.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                        <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.E6.m2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.E6.m2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>

          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex11">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\left.\frac{\partial^{2}\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{k}\partial x^{j%&#10;}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\gamma}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{%&#10;\partial x^{l}}+\frac{\partial^{2}\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{l}\partial x^{j}}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\gamma}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{%&#10;\partial x^{k}}+\frac{\partial^{2}\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{l}\partial x^{k}}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\gamma}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{%&#10;\partial x^{j}}\right)g^{ij}g^{kl}+" xml:id="S3.Ex11.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
