          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex12">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\left.2g^{ij}\frac{\partial g^{kl}}{\partial x^{i}}\left(\frac{%&#10;\partial\phi^{\gamma}}{\partial x^{j}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{%&#10;k}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{l}}\right)\right]+" xml:id="S3.Ex12.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>

          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex16">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\frac{\partial f}{\partial y^{\alpha}}\left[\frac{\partial^{2}%&#10;\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{k}\partial x^{l}}g^{ij}\frac{\partial^{2}g^{kl}}{%&#10;\partial x^{i}\partial x^{j}}+\frac{\partial^{3}\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{j}%&#10;\partial x^{k}\partial x^{l}}2g^{ij}\frac{\partial g^{kl}}{\partial x^{i}}+%&#10;\frac{\partial^{4}\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}\partial x^{j}\partial x^{k}%&#10;\partial x^{l}}g^{ij}g^{kl}\right]." text="(partial-differential@(f) / partial-differential@(y ^ alpha)) * delimited-[]@(((partial-differential ^ 2)@(phi ^ alpha) / (partial-differential@(x ^ k) * partial-differential@(x ^ l))) * g ^ (i * j) * ((partial-differential ^ 2)@(g ^ (k * l)) / (partial-differential@(x ^ i) * partial-differential@(x ^ j))) + ((partial-differential ^ 3)@(phi ^ alpha) / (partial-differential@(x ^ j) * partial-differential@(x ^ k) * partial-differential@(x ^ l))) * 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(g ^ (k * l)) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) + ((partial-differential ^ 4)@(phi ^ alpha) / (partial-differential@(x ^ i) * partial-differential@(x ^ j) * partial-differential@(x ^ k) * partial-differential@(x ^ l))) * g ^ (i * j) * g ^ (k * l))" xml:id="S3.Ex16.m2">

      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.p5">
        <p>Plugging carefully chosen local biharmonic test functions, as given
by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="A-G" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 2.4]</cite>, into Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eqe"/>) shows that <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S3.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a
biharmonic morphism if and only if</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx4">

            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle h^{\alpha\beta}\Delta(\lambda^{2})+\operatorname{div}{(\tau^{%&#10;\beta}(\phi)d\phi^{\alpha})}+\operatorname{div}{(\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)d\phi^{%&#10;\beta}})-\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)\tau^{\beta}(\phi)=\lambda^{2}dh^{\alpha\beta}(%&#10;\tau(\phi));" text="(h ^ (alpha * beta) * Delta * lambda ^ 2 + div@(tau ^ beta * phi * d * phi ^ alpha) + div@(tau ^ alpha * phi * d * phi ^ beta)) - tau ^ alpha * phi * tau ^ beta * phi = lambda ^ 2 * d * h ^ (alpha * beta) * tau * phi" xml:id="S3.E9.m2">

        <p>for all <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha,\beta=1,\dots,n" text="formulae@(list@(alpha, beta) = 1, list@(dots, n))" xml:id="S3.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.5"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.6"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m2.5">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m2.1">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m2.2">β</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S3.p5.m2.6">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S3.p5.m2.3">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m2.4">n</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.<break/>Clearly Equations (<ref labelref="LABEL:s1"/>) and (<ref labelref="LABEL:s2"/>) mean that <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S3.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is horizontally weakly conformal and <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S3.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic.<break/>On the other hand, Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:s3"/>) is equivalent to the vanishing of</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex17">
          <Math mode="display" tex="A^{\alpha\beta}=h^{\alpha\beta}\Delta(\lambda^{2})+g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{%&#10;\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}+g^{%&#10;ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\alpha}(\phi%&#10;)}{\partial x^{j}}+\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)\tau^{\beta}(\phi)-\lambda^{2}\frac{%&#10;\partial h^{\alpha\beta}}{\partial y^{p}}\tau^{p}(\phi)," text="A ^ (alpha * beta) = (h ^ (alpha * beta) * Delta * lambda ^ 2 + g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) + g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ beta) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ alpha) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) + tau ^ alpha * phi * tau ^ beta * phi) - lambda ^ 2 * (partial-differential@(h ^ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * tau ^ p * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex17.m1.6"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex17.m1.6">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

        <p>whose norm is easily shown to be</p>

                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle=n(\Delta\lambda^{2})^{2}+|\tau(\phi)|^{4}-2(\Delta\lambda^{2})|%&#10;\tau(\phi)|^{2}+4(\Delta\lambda^{2})\operatorname{div}{\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi%&#10;)\rangle}" text="absent = ((n * (Delta * lambda ^ 2) ^ 2 + (absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 4) - 2 * Delta * lambda ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 2) + 4 * Delta * lambda ^ 2 * div@(d * phi, tau * phi)" xml:id="S3.Ex18.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle+4\lambda^{2}g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}%&#10;\frac{\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}\frac{\partial h_{\alpha\beta%&#10;}}{\partial y^{p}}\tau^{p}(\phi)+\lambda^{4}\frac{\partial h^{\alpha\beta}}{%&#10;\partial y^{p}}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}\frac{\partial h^{\delta\mu}}{%&#10;\partial y^{q}}\tau^{p}(\phi)\tau^{q}(\phi)," text="+ 4 * lambda ^ 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * (partial-differential@(h _ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * tau ^ p * phi + lambda ^ 4 * (partial-differential@(h ^ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) * (partial-differential@(h ^ (delta * mu)) / partial-differential@(y ^ q)) * tau ^ p * phi * tau ^ q * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex21.m2">

                      <XMDual>

                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex21.m2.5">
                            <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>

        <p>since <Math mode="inline" tex="h^{\alpha\beta}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}=h_{\delta\mu}" text="h ^ (alpha * beta) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) = h _ (delta * mu)" xml:id="S3.p5.m5">

        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx6">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex22">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi)\rangle(\nabla|\tau(\phi)|^{2})=2g^{ij}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{%&#10;\partial x^{j}}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}\tau^{\delta}(\phi)\tau^{\mu}(\phi)%&#10;+\lambda^{2}\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)\tau^{\beta}(\phi)\frac{\partial h_{\alpha\beta%&#10;}}{\partial y^{p}}\tau^{p}(\phi)" text="list@(d * phi, tau * phi) * nabla@((absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 2) = 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) * tau ^ delta * phi * tau ^ mu * phi + lambda ^ 2 * tau ^ alpha * phi * tau ^ beta * phi * (partial-differential@(h _ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * tau ^ p * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex22.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>

        <p>and the components of <Math mode="inline" tex="S\in\odot^{2}\phi^{-1}TN" xml:id="S3.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="direct-product" name="odot" role="MULOP">⊙</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the symmetrization of <Math mode="inline" tex="g(d\phi,\nabla^{\phi}\tau(\phi))" text="g * open-interval@(d * phi, (nabla ^ phi)@(tau) * phi)" xml:id="S3.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m8.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m8.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m8.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m8.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m8.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex23">
          <Math mode="display" tex="S^{\alpha\beta}=g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{%&#10;\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}+\lambda^{2}h^{\alpha\delta}\Gamma^%&#10;{\beta}_{\gamma\delta}\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)+g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{%&#10;\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}+\lambda^{2}h%&#10;^{\beta\delta}\Gamma^{\alpha}_{\gamma\delta}\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)." text="S ^ (alpha * beta) = g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) + lambda ^ 2 * h ^ (alpha * delta) * (Gamma ^ beta) _ (gamma * delta) * tau ^ gamma * phi + g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ beta) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ alpha) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) + lambda ^ 2 * h ^ (beta * delta) * (Gamma ^ alpha) _ (gamma * delta) * tau ^ gamma * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex23.m1">

        <p>So its norm is</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx7">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex24">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle|S|^{2}=2g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{%&#10;\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}g^{kl}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\delta}}{\partial x^{k}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\mu}(\phi)}{%&#10;\partial x^{l}}+2g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{%&#10;\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}g^{kl}%&#10;\frac{\partial\phi^{\mu}}{\partial x^{k}}\frac{\partial\tau^{\delta}(\phi)}{%&#10;\partial x^{l}}" text="(absolute-value@(S)) ^ 2 = 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) * g ^ (k * l) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ delta) / partial-differential@(x ^ k)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ mu) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ l)) + 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) * g ^ (k * l) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ mu) / partial-differential@(x ^ k)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ delta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ l))" xml:id="S3.Ex24.m3">

          </equation>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex25">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle+4\lambda^{2}g^{ij}\frac{\partial\phi^{\alpha}}{\partial x^{i}}%&#10;\frac{\partial\tau^{\beta}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}\frac{\partial h_{\alpha\beta%&#10;}}{\partial y^{p}}\tau^{p}(\phi)+\lambda^{4}\frac{\partial h^{\alpha\beta}}{%&#10;\partial y^{p}}h_{\alpha\delta}h_{\beta\mu}\frac{\partial h^{\delta\mu}}{%&#10;\partial y^{q}}\tau^{p}(\phi)\tau^{q}(\phi)." text="+ 4 * lambda ^ 2 * g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ alpha) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ beta) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * (partial-differential@(h _ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * tau ^ p * phi + lambda ^ 4 * (partial-differential@(h ^ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ p)) * h _ (alpha * delta) * h _ (beta * mu) * (partial-differential@(h ^ (delta * mu)) / partial-differential@(y ^ q)) * tau ^ p * phi * tau ^ q * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex25.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex25.m3.5"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex25.m3.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p>Hence (<ref labelref="LABEL:s3"/>) is equivalent to Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:longeq"/>).<break/>To obtain that Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:s4"/>) is biharmonicity, observe that</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx8">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex26">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle-(\Delta^{\phi}\tau(\phi))^{\alpha}=g^{ij}\left[\frac{\partial^{2%&#10;}\tau^{\alpha}(\phi)}{\partial x^{i}\partial x^{j}}+\frac{\partial\tau^{\gamma%&#10;}(\phi)}{\partial x^{j}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{i}}\Gamma^{%&#10;\alpha}_{\beta\gamma}+\frac{\partial\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)}{\partial x^{i}}\frac{%&#10;\partial\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{j}}\Gamma^{\alpha}_{\beta\gamma}+\tau^{%&#10;\gamma}(\phi)\frac{\partial^{2}\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{i}\partial x^{j}}%&#10;\Gamma^{\alpha}_{\beta\gamma}\right." xml:id="S3.Ex26.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                        <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>

        <p>since <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S3.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is horizontally weakly conformal, <Math mode="inline" tex="g^{ij}\frac{\partial^{2}}{\partial x^{i}\partial x^{j}}\tau^{\alpha_{0}}(\phi)=0" text="g ^ (i * j) * (partial-differential ^ 2 / (partial-differential@(x ^ i) * partial-differential@(x ^ j))) * tau ^ (alpha _ 0) * phi = 0" xml:id="S3.p5.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMApp>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>

                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m10.1"/>

                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m10.1">ϕ</XMTok>

                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and we are working with harmonic coordinates.<break/>On the other hand, <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{trace}{{\mathrm{R}}^{N}(d\phi,\tau(\phi))d\phi}=\lambda^{2}{%&#10;\mathrm{Ric}}^{N}\tau(\phi)" text="trace@(R ^ N) * open-interval@(d * phi, tau * phi) * d * phi = lambda ^ 2 * Ric ^ N * tau * phi" xml:id="S3.p5.m11">

        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx9">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex29">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle-\lambda^{2}{\mathrm{Ric}}^{N}\tau(\phi)=\lambda^{2}\left[-\frac{%&#10;\partial h^{\alpha\beta}}{\partial y^{\gamma}}\Gamma^{\delta}_{\alpha\beta}-h^%&#10;{\alpha\beta}\frac{\partial\Gamma^{\delta}_{\alpha\gamma}}{\partial y^{\beta}}%&#10;-\sum_{\mu=1}^{n}h^{\alpha\beta}\Gamma^{\mu}_{\alpha\gamma}\Gamma^{\delta}_{%&#10;\mu\beta}\right]\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)." text="- lambda ^ 2 * Ric ^ N * tau * phi = lambda ^ 2 * delimited-[]@(- (partial-differential@(h ^ (alpha * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ gamma)) * (Gamma ^ delta) _ (alpha * beta) - h ^ (alpha * beta) * (partial-differential@((Gamma ^ delta) _ (alpha * gamma)) / partial-differential@(y ^ beta)) - ((sum _ (mu = 1)) ^ n)@(h ^ (alpha * beta) * (Gamma ^ mu) _ (alpha * gamma) * (Gamma ^ delta) _ (mu * beta))) * tau ^ gamma * phi" xml:id="S3.Ex29.m3">

        <p>Thus</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx10">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex30">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\tau^{2}(\phi)=\left[2g^{ij}\frac{\partial\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)}{%&#10;\partial x^{i}}\frac{\partial\phi^{\beta}}{\partial x^{j}}\Gamma^{\alpha}_{%&#10;\beta\gamma}+\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)\tau^{\beta}(\phi)\Gamma^{\alpha}_{\beta\gamma%&#10;}-\lambda^{2}\frac{\partial h^{\delta\beta}}{\partial y^{\gamma}}\Gamma^{%&#10;\alpha}_{\delta\beta}\tau^{\gamma}(\phi)\right]\frac{\partial}{\partial y^{%&#10;\alpha}}=0." text="tau ^ 2 * phi = delimited-[]@((2 * g ^ (i * j) * ((partial-differential@(tau ^ gamma) * phi) / partial-differential@(x ^ i)) * (partial-differential@(phi ^ beta) / partial-differential@(x ^ j)) * (Gamma ^ alpha) _ (beta * gamma) + tau ^ gamma * phi * tau ^ beta * phi * (Gamma ^ alpha) _ (beta * gamma)) - lambda ^ 2 * (partial-differential@(h ^ (delta * beta)) / partial-differential@(y ^ gamma)) * (Gamma ^ alpha) _ (delta * beta) * tau ^ gamma * phi) * (partial-differential / partial-differential@(y ^ alpha)) = 0" xml:id="S3.Ex30.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>

                                </XMApp>

<!--  %**** String Line 450 **** -->        <p>Of course, Conditions (<ref labelref="LABEL:s1"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:s4"/>) are also sufficient.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S3.p6">
      <p>It is well-known that harmonic morphisms into <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S3.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-dimensional manifolds have an
interesting link to the geometry of the fibres, which can be stated as: a horizontally
conformal submersion <Math mode="inline" tex="(M^{m},g)\longrightarrow(N^{2},h)" text="open-interval@(M ^ m, g) longrightarrow open-interval@(N ^ 2, h)" xml:id="S3.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟶</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m2.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m2.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p6.m2.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m2.1">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m2.4"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p6.m2.4">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m2.2">h</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is harmonic (hence a harmonic
morphism) if and only if it has minimal fibres. The corresponding result for
biharmonic morphisms is partially true.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_cor" inlist="thm theorem:cor" xml:id="Thmcor1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Corollary 1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmcor1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">A biharmonic morphism <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi:(M^{m},g)\longrightarrow(N^{4},h)" text="phi colon open-interval@(M ^ m, g) longrightarrow open-interval@(N ^ 4, h)" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟶</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmcor1.p1.m1.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmcor1.p1.m1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m1.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmcor1.p1.m1.4"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmcor1.p1.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m1.4">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m1.2">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (<Math mode="inline" tex="m\geqslant 4" text="m &gt;= 4" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geqslant" role="RELOP">⩾</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>), with
a <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-dimensional target, always has minimal fibres. However there exist horizontally
conformal submersions which are <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="Thmcor1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-harmonic, have minimal fibres but are not
biharmonic morphisms.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p7">
        <p>By Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm1"/>, a biharmonic morphism is a <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S3.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic morphism. The first
statement then follows from a result in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="B-G" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that a horizontally weakly
conformal map <Math mode="inline" tex="(M^{m},g)\longrightarrow(N^{n},h)" text="open-interval@(M ^ m, g) longrightarrow open-interval@(N ^ n, h)" xml:id="S3.p7.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟶</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m2.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m2.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m2.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m2.1">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m2.4"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m2.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m2.2">h</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is a <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.p7.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic map (hence a <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.p7.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic morphism) with <Math mode="inline" tex="p=n=\dim{N}" text="p = n = dimension@(N)" xml:id="S3.p7.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="dimension" role="LIMITOP">dim</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if it has minimal fibres.<break/>It is well-known that the radial projection <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi:\mathbb{R}^{5}\setminus\{0\}\longrightarrow{{\mathbb{S}}}^{4},\;%&#10;\varphi(x)=x/|x|" text="varphi colon formulae@(R ^ 5 set-minus set@(0) longrightarrow S ^ 4, varphi * x = x / absolute-value@(x))" xml:id="S3.p7.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.4"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.5"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m6.4">
                      <XMTok name="longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟶</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="5" role="NUMBER">5</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p7.m6.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="2.8pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m6.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m6.2">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m6.3">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a horizontally homothetic
submersion with totally geodesic fibres and hence a harmonic morphism
(see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="B-W" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>). It is also a <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.p7.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic morphism for any <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.p7.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and, in particular,
a <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S3.p7.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic morphism. However, the radial projection <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi:\mathbb{R}^{m}\setminus\{0\}\longrightarrow{{\mathbb{S}}}^{m-1},\;%&#10;\varphi(x)=x/|x|" text="varphi colon formulae@(R ^ m set-minus set@(0) longrightarrow S ^ (m - 1), varphi * x = x / absolute-value@(x))" xml:id="S3.p7.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m10.4"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m10.5"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m10.4">
                      <XMTok name="longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟶</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m10.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p7.m10.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="2.8pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m10.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m10.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m10.2">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m10.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m10.3">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a
<!--  %**** String Line 475 **** -->biharmonic morphism if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="m=4" text="m = 4" xml:id="S3.p7.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ou" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rk" inlist="thm theorem:rk" xml:id="Thmrk5">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 5</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="Thmrk5.p1">
        <p>1) A straightforward computation shows that if <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmrk5.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a biharmonic morphism then
there exists a continuous function <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda" text="lambda" xml:id="Thmrk5.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="Thmrk5.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex31">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\tau^{2}(\psi\circ\phi)=\lambda^{4}\tau^{2}(\psi)\circ\phi," text="tau ^ 2 * (psi compose phi) = (lambda ^ 4 * tau ^ 2 * psi) compose phi" xml:id="S3.Ex31.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex31.m1.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex31.m1.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Ex31.m1.2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex31.m1.2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Ex31.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex31.m1.1">ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>for any map <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="Thmrk5.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (including functions).<break/>2) Taking the trace of Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:s3"/>) yields</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:trace" xml:id="S3.E11">
          <tags>
            <tag>(11)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">11</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="n\Delta(\lambda^{2})+2\operatorname{div}{\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi)\rangle}=|%&#10;\tau(\phi)|^{2}," text="n * Delta * lambda ^ 2 + 2 * div@(d * phi, tau * phi) = (absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 2" xml:id="S3.E11.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.E11.m1.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.4.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.E11.m1.4.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.4.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.4.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.E11.m1.2">div</XMTok>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.E11.m1.4.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.E11.m1.4.3">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E11.m1.1">ϕ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.4.4"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.E11.m1.4.4">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.E11.m1.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E11.m1.3">ϕ</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>hence by Stokes’ Theorem, biharmonic morphisms on a compact manifold without boundary
are exactly homothetic submersions with minimal fibres. See <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="L-O" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> for similar results.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S3.p8">
      <p>Apart from harmonic morphisms with harmonic dilation, examples of biharmonic
morphisms are hard to unearth. Conformal maps in dimension four have the double
advantage of satisfying automatically two of the four conditions, namely horizontal
weak conformality and <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S3.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-harmonicity. Once biharmonicity is secured, remains only
Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:longeq"/>) to fulfil, though no geometric insight is yet at our
disposal.</p>
    </para>

        <p><text font="italic">is a biharmonic morphism if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="n=4" text="n = 4" xml:id="Thmthm2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p9">
        <p>By <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="B-K" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the inversion in the unit sphere is a biharmonic map if and only if
<Math mode="inline" tex="n=4" text="n = 4" xml:id="S3.p9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Moreover the map</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx12">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex34">

                          <XMApp>

        </equationgroup>
        <p>is clearly a conformal map of dilation <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda^{2}=\frac{1}{|x|^{4}}" text="lambda ^ 2 = 1 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 4" xml:id="S3.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m2.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> between spaces
of dimension four, hence a <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="S3.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-harmonic map (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ou" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>) and <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau(\phi)=-4\frac{x}{|x|^{4}}" text="tau * phi = - 4 * (x / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 4)" xml:id="S3.p9.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m4.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m4.2">ϕ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m4.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m4.1">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Using the standard coordinates <Math mode="inline" tex="\{x^{\alpha}\}_{\alpha=1,2,3,4}" text="(set@(x ^ alpha)) _ (alpha = list@(1, 2, 3, 4))" xml:id="S3.p9.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.5"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m5.5">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.2">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.3">3</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.4">4</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}}^{4}" text="R ^ 4" xml:id="S3.p9.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, simple computations show that</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx13">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex36">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle|\tau(\phi)|^{2}=\frac{16}{|x|^{6}};\quad\Delta\lambda^{2}=\frac{%&#10;8}{|x|^{6}};\quad\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi)\rangle=4\frac{x}{|x|^{6}};\quad%&#10;\operatorname{div}\langle d\phi,\tau(\phi)\rangle=-\frac{8}{|x|^{6}}." text="formulae@((absolute-value@(tau * phi)) ^ 2 = 16 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 6, formulae@(Delta * lambda ^ 2 = 8 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 6, formulae@(list@(d * phi, tau * phi) = 4 * (x / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 6), div@(d * phi, tau * phi) = - 8 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 6)))" xml:id="S3.Ex36.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex36.m3.9"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S3.Ex36.m3.9">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Ex36.m3.9.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Ex36.m3.9.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex36.m3.9.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex36.m3.9.1.1"/>
                                </XMApp>

<!--  %**** String Line 525 **** -->        <p>As to the symmetric tensor <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S3.p9.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we have</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx14">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex37">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle S^{\alpha\alpha}=-\tfrac{8}{|x|^{8}}\left(|x|^{2}+2(x^{\alpha})^%&#10;{2}\right);\quad S^{\alpha\beta}=-\tfrac{16}{|x|^{8}}x^{\alpha}x^{\beta}," text="formulae@(S ^ (alpha * alpha) = - (8 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 8) * ((absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 + 2 * x ^ alpha ^ 2), S ^ (alpha * beta) = - (16 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 8) * x ^ alpha * x ^ beta)" xml:id="S3.Ex37.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex37.m3.4"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S3.Ex37.m3.4">
                        <XMApp>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
              <MathBranch>
                <td align="right"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle S^{\alpha\alpha}" text="S ^ (alpha * alpha)" xml:id="S3.Ex37.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle=-\tfrac{8}{|x|^{8}}\left(|x|^{2}+2(x^{\alpha})^{2}\right);\quad S%&#10;^{\alpha\beta}=-\tfrac{16}{|x|^{8}}x^{\alpha}x^{\beta}," text="formulae@(absent = - (8 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 8) * ((absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2 + 2 * x ^ alpha ^ 2), S ^ (alpha * beta) = - (16 / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 8) * x ^ alpha * x ^ beta)" xml:id="S3.Ex37.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMDual>

                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p>for all <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha\neq\beta=1,\dots,4" text="formulae@(alpha not-equals beta = 1, list@(dots, 4))" xml:id="S3.p9.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m8.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m8.4"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m8.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S3.p9.m8.4">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S3.p9.m8.1">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m8.2">4</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, so <Math mode="inline" tex="|S|^{2}=\tfrac{3(16)^{2}}{|x|^{12}}" text="(absolute-value@(S)) ^ 2 = (3 * 16 ^ 2) / (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 12" xml:id="S3.p9.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m9.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m9.3">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m9.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="16" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m9.1">16</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m9.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m9.2">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Therefore <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S3.p9.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfies Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:longeq"/>) and is a biharmonic morphism.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§4</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">4</tag>Biharmonicity and conformality</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">4</tag>Biharmonicity and conformality</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S4.p1">
      <p>Since biharmonic morphisms appear so rigid, we drop two of their characteristic
conditions and only keep horizontal weak conformality and biharmonicity. In the light of
the Fuglede-Ishihara theorem, such maps are the exact counterparts of harmonic
morphisms. Moreover, the expression of the tension field of a horizontally weakly
conformal map enlightens the relationship between minimality of the fibres and
harmonicity of the map. Though the formula for the bitension field is far more
intricate, we can apply it to some special cases to obtain new examples of
biharmonic maps.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S4.p2">
      <p>We will denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu=\tfrac{1}{m-n}\sum_{s=1}^{m-n}(\nabla_{e_{s}}e_{s})^{\mathcal{H}}" text="mu = (1 / (m - n)) * ((sum _ (s = 1)) ^ (m - n))@(((nabla _ e _ s)@(e _ s)) ^ H)" xml:id="S4.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.p2.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.p2.m1.1">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
