        <p>is a biharmonic map if and only if</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx49">
          <equation labels="LABEL:2D" xml:id="S4.E13">
            <tags>
              <tag>(13)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">13</tag>
            </tags>
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle 0=-\lambda^{4}\operatorname{grad}_{h}(\Delta_{h}\ln\beta)-2%&#10;\lambda^{4}G_{h}\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta+\tfrac{3}{2}V(\lambda^{2}|%&#10;\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta|^{2})V" text="0 = (- lambda ^ 4 * (grad _ h)@(Delta _ h * natural-logarithm@(beta)) - 2 * lambda ^ 4 * G _ h * (grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta))) + (3 / 2) * V * lambda ^ 2 * (absolute-value@((grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta)))) ^ 2 * V" xml:id="S4.E13.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMRef idref="S4.E13.m3.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S4.E13.m3.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S4.E13.m3.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">grad</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.E13.m3.2">
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>

                          </XMApp>

        </equationgroup>
        <p>which are proper biharmonic maps.<break/></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="Thmex2.p2">
        <p>In fact, it is easily checked that <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a horizontally conformal
submersion of dilation <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda^{2}" text="lambda ^ 2" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.<break/>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be the unit vertical vector <Math mode="inline" tex="\frac{1}{\beta}\frac{d}{dt}" text="(1 / beta) * (d / (d * t))" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, using the Koszul
formula one can show that for vector fields <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}}\times M^{2}" text="R * M ^ 2" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math></p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex149">
          <Math mode="display" tex="A_{E}F=g(E^{\mathcal{H}},F^{\mathcal{H}})V(\ln\lambda)V." text="A _ E * F = g * open-interval@(E ^ H, F ^ H) * V * natural-logarithm@(lambda) * V" xml:id="S4.Ex149.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.Ex149.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex149.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex149.m1.1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex149.m1.1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex149.m1.1.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex149.m1.1.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Ex149.m1.1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex149.m1.1.3">
                            <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>On the other hand, if <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a vertical vector field, then</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex150">
          <Math mode="display" tex="B_{V}W=-\lambda^{2}\operatorname{grad}_{h}(\ln\beta)\langle W,V\rangle." text="B _ V * W = - lambda ^ 2 * (grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta)) * list@(W, V)" xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.Ex150.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex150.m1.3.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex150.m1.3.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">grad</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1.3.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex150.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex150.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1.1">W</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex150.m1.2">V</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Note also that the mean curvature of the fibres is <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu=\nabla^{g}_{V}V=-\lambda^{2}\operatorname{grad}_{h}(\ln\beta)" text="mu = ((nabla ^ g) _ V)@(V) = - lambda ^ 2 * (grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta))" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p2.m9.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p2.m9.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m9.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">grad</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m9.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the mean curvature of the horizontal distribution
is <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu=V(\ln\lambda)V" text="nu = V * natural-logarithm@(lambda) * V" xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p2.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Thmex2.p2.m10.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.<break/></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="Thmex2.p3">
        <p>Choosing a geodesic frame <Math mode="inline" tex="\{e_{1},e_{2}\}" text="set@(e _ 1, e _ 2)" xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p3.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> around a point
<Math mode="inline" tex="p\in M^{2}" text="p element-of M ^ 2" xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and evaluating all subsequent formulas at a point <Math mode="inline" tex="(p,t)\in M^{2}\times{{\mathbb{R}}}" text="open-interval@(p, t) element-of M ^ 2 * R" xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                    <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p3.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Thmex2.p3.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Thmex2.p3.m3.2">t</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>

          </Math>, straightforward computations show that (summing on repeated indices)</p>

      </para>
      <para xml:id="Thmex2.p4">
        <p>Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{grad}^{\mathcal{H}}\ln\lambda=0" text="(grad ^ H)@(natural-logarithm@(lambda)) = 0" xml:id="Thmex2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">grad</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the only remaining terms are</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx52">
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex154">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle[\nabla_{\mu}\mu]^{\mathcal{H}}=\tfrac{\lambda^{4}}{2}%&#10;\operatorname{grad}_{h}(|\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta|_{h}^{2});" text="(delimited-[]@((nabla _ mu)@(mu))) ^ H = (lambda ^ 4 / 2) * (grad _ h)@(((absolute-value@((grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta)))) _ h) ^ 2)" xml:id="S4.Ex154.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Ex154.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex154.m3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S4.Ex154.m3.1.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex154.m3.1.1">
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                  <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>

        <p>So the projection <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmex2.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is biharmonic if and only if (still summing on repeated
indices)</p>

                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle=-\lambda^{4}e_{i}(e_{i}(e_{j}\ln\beta)))e_{j}-V(V(\lambda e_{j}(%&#10;\ln\beta)))\lambda e_{j}-\tfrac{\lambda^{4}}{2}\operatorname{grad}_{h}|%&#10;\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta|_{h}^{2}" xml:id="S4.Ex162.m2">

        <p>Using</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx54">

          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex167">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle V(\lambda e_{j}(\ln\beta))\lambda e_{j}=\nabla_{V}(\lambda^{2}%&#10;\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta)-\lambda^{2}|\operatorname{grad}_{h}\ln\beta|_%&#10;{h}^{2}V;" text="V * lambda * e _ j * natural-logarithm@(beta) * lambda * e _ j = (nabla _ V)@(lambda ^ 2 * (grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta))) - lambda ^ 2 * ((absolute-value@((grad _ h)@(natural-logarithm@(beta)))) _ h) ^ 2 * V" xml:id="S4.Ex167.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Ex167.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex167.m2.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex167.m2.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex167.m2.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex167.m2.1.1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex167.m2.1.1.1">
                                      <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>

                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>

                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p>we obtain the biharmonic equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:2D"/>) for <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="Thmex2.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.<break/></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="Thmex2.p5">

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>

                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>

              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p>Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:2D"/>) reduces to</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex174">
          <Math mode="display" tex="ff^{\prime}+f^{\prime\prime}=0," text="f * f ^ prime + f ^ prime2 = 0" xml:id="S4.Ex174.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.Ex174.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex174.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime2" role="SUPOP">′′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="f=\ln\beta" text="f = natural-logarithm@(beta)" xml:id="Thmex2.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Solving this equation, we obtain the last statement in the
example.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
  </section>
